item.title: Report X-2024020761
item.description:
Report X-2024020761

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-30
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As the package was being unloaded the package handler noticed the top of the box being wet. DescribePack: Loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the package was discovered the package was placed in a hazmat tote, taken to the damaged hazmat cage, and set under the vent.

item.title: Report X-2024020833
item.description:
Report X-2024020833

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was removed from the package flow due to leaking carton; package was then brought to QA for further inspection. DescribePack: Two bottles of Rapticide PA Part A have leaked its content through vented caps. Package also contains Rapicide Part B bottles which have been exposed / soiled by the leaking one. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024020555
item.description:
Report X-2024020555

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: SPOKANE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On Jan 31st a package was found to be wet and smelled of fuel. Inside the package was a small internal combustion engine that had not been properly drained resulting in the fuel spill. There were no indications or markings on the outside of the package that it contained and dangerous goods. The package was cleaned and contained in steel salvage drum pending further disposition.

item.title: Report X-2024020507
item.description:
Report X-2024020507

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-15T12:17:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: AUBURN
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was noticed to be wet and leaking, box was then brought over to QA for further inspection. DescribePack: Two bottles of Cidehol 70% isopropyl alcohol solution have leaked out some of their content through the sides of the caps. Two other bottles have come in contact with the leaking bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside lined tote and isolated from the rest of the package.

item.title: Report X-2024020172
item.description:
Report X-2024020172

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-12T18:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-31
  • City: SEATTLE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS BROUGHT TO DMP AFTER BEING DISCOVERED BY SUPERVISOR AMIDST OTHER PACKAGES WHICH WERE WET WITH RAINWATER. THE PACKAGE APPEARED TO BE SLIGHTLY DAMP ON THE BOTTOM WHERE IT STOOD, SO IT WAS PRESUMED TO HAVE BEEN ALSO DAMAGED BY RAINWATER (COLORLESS LIQUID). RESPONDER DISCOVERED THAT THE PACKAGE CONTINUED LEAKING. RESPONDER DETERMINED AT THIS TIME THAT IT WAS LIKELY ACTUALLY A LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER PROCESSED LEAKING HAZMAT PACKAGE THROUGH DMP PROCEDURES.
